availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oscar H. Burbridge (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Mason Burbridge in Bourbon County, Kentucky, on January 8, 1846. Father of Eliza A. Burbridge, James M Burbridge, Robert Burbridge, Oscar H. Burbridge Jr., Mary L. Burbridge, Hattie W. Burbridge, and Stephen Burbridge. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1850. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1860. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 231A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 2, p. 454.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division, p. 610-1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Eastern Division p. 119B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 256A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bourbon County Marriages, Film #000183145, p. 103.
"Oscar H. Burbridge (1821-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #126805680, accessed May 20, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126805680.
